question_details.title: Will there be a new world record in the 2025 World Figure Skating Championships?
question_details.description:
[Figure skating](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Figure_skating) is a winter sport in which individuals, pairs, or groups perform on ice while incorporating jumps, spins, lifts, and footwork into choreographed routines set to music. The [World Figure Skating Championships](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2025_World_Figure_Skating_Championships), organised annually by the [International Skating Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Skating_Union) (ISU) since 1896, represents the most prestigious annual competition in the sport outside the Olympic Games. The [2025 World Championships](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2025_World_Figure_Skating_Championships) are scheduled to take place in Boston, from March 25 to March 30.

In all official competitions, athletes are scored using the [ISU Judging System](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISU_Judging_System), which consists of two components: the Technical Score (TES) and the Program Components Score (PCS). The Technical Score assesses the difficulty and execution of specific elements (jumps, spins, and step sequences) with each element receiving a base value [ranging](https://www.usfigureskating.org/sites/default/files/media-files/ISU%202656%20ISU_SOV_SinglesPairs_2024-25_final.pdf) from 0.40 to 14, which is then adjusted using a -5 to +5 grade based on the athlete's execution. The Program Components Score evaluates five aspects of the performance: skating skills, transitions, performance, composition, and interpretation of music, with judges awarding points on a scale of 0.25 to 10.00 in each category.

The TES and PCS are added together to form the Total Segment Score (TSS), which is calculated for both short programs and free skating and added together to determine an athlete's final ranking.
question_details.resolution_criteria:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if in the 2025 World Figure Skating Championships, there is a new world record in any category (men's singles, women's singles, pairs, ice dance), for any segment, on any of the possible scores:

* TES – Technical element score
* PCS – Program component score
* TSS – Total segment score
* Combine Total TSS across segments.
question_details.fine_print:
* If at least half of the 2025 World Figure Skating Championships events do not take place before April 7, 2025, this question will be **annulled**.
* In case a performance setting a new record is announced, but has not been officially verified (in case of potential disputes), it will count for the purposes of this question if it has not been cancelled as of April 7, 2025.
* The [current world records](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_highest_scores_in_figure_skating) are presented below:

| Category        | Segment        | Score type | Score  |
| --------------- | -------------- | ---------- | ------ |
| Men's singles   | Combined total | TSS        | 335.30 |
| Men's singles   | Short program  | TSS        | 113.97 |
| Men's singles   | Short program  | TES        | 65.98  |
| Men's singles   | Short program  | PCS        | 48.47  |
| Men's singles   | Free skating   | TSS        | 227.79 |
| Men's singles   | Free skating   | TES        | 137.18 |
| Men's singles   | Free skating   | PCS        | 97.22  |
| Women's singles | Combined total | TSS        | 272.71 |
| Women's singles | Short program  | TSS        | 87.52  |
| Women's singles | Short program  | TES        | 49.97  |
| Women's singles | Short program  | PCS        | 37.56  |
| Women's singles | Free skating   | TSS        | 185.29 |
| Women's singles | Free skating   | TES        | 109.02 |
| Women's singles | Free skating   | PCS        | 76.27  |
| Pairs           | Combined total | TSS        | 239.88 |
| Pairs           | Short program  | TSS        | 84.41  |
| Pairs           | Short program  | TES        | 46.04  |
| Pairs           | Short program  | PCS        | 38.45  |
| Pairs           | Free skating   | TSS        | 157.46 |
| Pairs           | Free skating   | TES        | 81.45  |
| Pairs           | Free skating   | PCS        | 76.99  |
| Ice dance       | Combined total | TSS        | 232.32 |
| Ice dance       | Rhythm dance   | TSS        | 93.91  |
| Ice dance       | Rhythm dance   | TES        | 55.16  |
| Ice dance       | Rhythm dance   | PCS        | 39.57  |
| Ice dance       | Free dance     | TSS        | 138.41 |
| Ice dance       | Free dance     | TES        | 79.41  |
| Ice dance       | Free dance     | PCS        | 59.70  |

‎

news:
Here are the relevant news articles:

**The Final Episode of 'Figure Skating TV': A Farewell to a Beloved Program**
The final episode of 'Figure Skating TV' will air on March 9th at 14:00. The show will feature the national middle school skating competition, where middle school skaters will compete to be part of the Japanese team for the upcoming World Championships. The show will also include interviews with the Japanese team's representatives and a review of the recent Four Continents and World Junior Championships. The show's absence in April means that a review of the World Championships will not be possible. The show's end marks the decline of figure skating-related programs, which will make it harder for non-skating enthusiasts to stumble upon them. However, it's worth noting that figure skaters like Yuzuru Hanyu will still make appearances on variety shows to promote the sport.
Original language: ja
Publish date: March 08, 2025 02:18 PM
Source:[goo blog](https://blog.goo.ne.jp/ico3/e/1ac6c139c2650b0baba5f60dbde5606b)

**Mark Kondratuk: 'I Performed Better in the 2024/25 Season Than in the Olympic Season'**
Mark Kondratuk, the European champion in figure skating, stated that he performed better in the 2024/25 season than in the Olympic season. Kondratuk participated in a show program on the sixth stage of the Moscow Sports Cup. He is a bronze medalist of the 2022 Winter Olympics in the team event, European champion, and winner of the Russian championship. In the 2024/25 season, he took second place in the Russian Grand Prix Final and fifth place in the Russian championship, where he led after the short program. Kondratuk said, 'The season was wave-like. In my subjective opinion, the season went well. There was only one failure in the free program at the Russian championship. Otherwise, the stages went well, the control skates too, the Russian Grand Prix Final, and the jump tournament. If we look at the average level of skating and scores, I performed better this year than in the Olympic season. Therefore, I think everything is fine, and we just need to continue working.' Kondratuk plans to take a break and then attend training camps. He said, 'I would like to go somewhere to rest. I don't know yet where. And then there will be training camps. I don't know yet where and when. But, as usual, there will be training camps and preparation. Now, we need to perform at the team tournament and the show program tournament, and the season will be over.'
Original language: ru
Publish date: March 08, 2025 12:37 PM
Source:[MATCHTV.RU](https://matchtv.ru/figure-skating/matchtvnews_NI2177327_Kondratuk_Vystupaju_v_etom_godu_luchshe_chem_v_olimpijskij_sezon_Za_vse_prokaty_byla_odna_neudacha_v_proizvolnoj_programme_ChR)

**Daisuke Takahashi's 'Sliding House' Embarks on a New Phase**
The final rehearsal of the ice show 'Sliding House' (, 'Hayasaka-ya') produced by Daisuke Takahashi ended on March 7th in Hiroshima. Takahashi, the show's director, greeted the attendees with a smile, saying, 'I'm so sorry, I made a mistake!' The lighthearted moment brought a sense of unity to the group. Takahashi's humility is characteristic of his genuine passion for figure skating. As a pioneer in the figure skating world, Takahashi achieved unprecedented success, including Olympic medals and victories in the Grand Prix Final and World Championships. After his retirement, he returned to competition four years later and won the silver medal at the All-Japan Championships. He then transitioned to ice dance and rose to the top 10 in the world, becoming the All-Japan champion. Given his impressive background, the 'Sliding House' show is sure to be exceptional.

Publish date: March 08, 2025 09:33 AM

**Today in Sports - Lindsey Vonn wins her 10th career World Cup downhill to break the U.S. record**
Today in sports history, several notable events took place. In 1954, the Milwaukee Hawks beat the Baltimore Bullets twice in a doubleheader. In 2008, Lindsey Vonn broke the U.S. record for most World Cup downhill wins, with her 10th career victory. She achieved this feat on the 1.4-mile Crans-Montana, Switzerland course in 1:23.57. Other notable events include Joe Frazier's win over Muhammad Ali in 1971, Kurt Browning's defense of his title in the World Figure Skating Championships in 1990, and Aaron Rodgers' reported 4-year, $200m deal to remain with the Green Bay Packers in 2022.

**Kazakhstan's Figure Skating Team Aims to Make a Statement at the 2025 World Championships**
The Kazakhstani figure skating team, consisting of Mikhail Shaidarov and Sofia Samodelkina, will compete at the 2025 World Figure Skating Championships in Boston. The event will be a crucial test for the team as they aim to make a statement on the world stage. Shaidarov will face stiff competition from stars like Ilya Malinin, Yuma Kagiyama, and Adam Siao Him Fa, while Samodelkina will compete against top female figure skaters, including Kaori Sakamoto, Isabeau Levito, and others. Can the Kazakhstani team surprise the judges and spectators? We will find out soon, as the championships are just a few weeks away.
Original language: ru
Publish date: March 07, 2025 12:52 PM
Source:[Pravda](https://www.pravda.ru/news/sport/2188901-kazakhstan-figure-skaters/)

**Russian Figure Skater Adelia Petrosyan Opens Up About Nationality-Related Humiliation**
Russian figure skater Adelia Petrosyan told 'Pro Gorod' that she has faced humiliation due to her nationality and physical appearance. She said that in the past, she was subjected to bullying because of her short height, but now the situation has changed. 'Before, there were many insults about my height and nationality. Now, they analyze every word and glance. I don't try to be good. I don't need everyone to like me, and I don't like pretending to be something I'm not,' Petrosyan said. Despite facing these challenges, Petrosyan has achieved great success in her career, winning the Grand Prix final in women's singles figure skating on February 16 and defending her title as Russian champion in the same discipline in December last year. The International Skating Union (ISU) has also allowed Russian and Belarusian athletes to compete in the qualification tournament for the 2026 Winter Olympics in a neutral status. The qualification tournament for figure skating will take place in China from September 17 to 21 next year, with the Olympics scheduled to take place in February 2026 in Milan and Cortina d'Ampezzo, Italy.
Original language: ru
Publish date: March 07, 2025 12:14 PM
Source:[������.Ru](https://www.gazeta.ru/sport/news/2025/03/07/25256144.shtml)

**Vladislav Dikij Becomes First to Perform Quadruple Axel on Lake Baikal Ice**
Russian figure skater Vladislav Dikij has become the first person to perform a quadruple axel on the ice of Lake Baikal. Dikij, who won the Russian championship in Omsk on December 21, shared a video of his achievement on his Telegram channel. The International Skating Union (ISU) has allowed Russian and Belarusian athletes to participate in the Olympic qualification tournament in a neutral status. The qualification tournament for figure skating will take place in China from September 17 to 21, 2025. The 2026 Winter Olympics will be held in Milan and Cortina d'Ampezzo, Italy. 'It's a great day,' Dikij's achievement is a testament to his hard work and dedication to the sport. As for the Olympic qualification, it's a step in the right direction for Russian and Belarusian athletes, who have been facing challenges in recent years.
Original language: ru
Publish date: March 07, 2025 11:46 AM
Source:[������.Ru](https://www.gazeta.ru/sport/news/2025/03/07/25256012.shtml)

**Medvedeva Calls Novogorsky Training Camp a 'Prison'**
Russian figure skater Evgenia Medvedeva described the training camp in Novogorsky as a 'prison' and 'hell' in the show 'Football Skating'. According to her, the atmosphere of the national team's training camp, which takes place in the UT 'Novogorsky', does not add enthusiasm to her life. 'From 2010 to 2018, every summer was two stable months in Novogorsky. Novogorsky for all figure skaters is simply a prison, a hell', Medvedeva said. Medvedeva has a impressive career, with two Olympic silver medals, two gold medals at the World and European Championships, and a bronze medal at the World Championships. She announced her retirement in April 2023. The qualification tournament for the 2026 Winter Olympics will take place in China from September 17 to 21, 2025.
Original language: ru
Publish date: March 07, 2025 10:49 AM
Source:[������.Ru](https://www.gazeta.ru/sport/news/2025/03/07/25255418.shtml)

**Belarus Submits Expanded Application for Olympic Figure Skating Qualifying Tournament**
Belarus has submitted an expanded application to participate in the Olympic qualifying tournament for figure skating in Beijing in September 2025. According to our information, the application was submitted in an expanded format, not in the 1+1 format (main + reserve) as required by the ISU. Several reserve athletes have also filled out applications for neutral status. Sources suggest that the main athletes will be Evgeny Puzanov for men, Victoria Safonova for women, and Ekaterina Andreeva/Dmitry Blinov for dance. It is uncertain whether Belarus will participate in the qualification for pairs. As one source noted, the applications were not only filled out by the main athlete, but also by two reserve athletes - as was the case for dance, men, and women. This is in contrast to Russia, which also submitted an expanded application, including 5-6 top athletes in each discipline, as reported by 'Sport-Express' earlier. However, this has not been officially confirmed, and the decision will be announced when the information from the ISU is received, according to Alexander Kogan, the general director of the Russian federation.
Original language: ru
Publish date: March 07, 2025 10:05 AM
Source:[Спорт-Экспресс](https://www.sport-express.ru/olympics/winter/figure-skating/news/belorussiya-podala-rasshirennuyu-zayavku-na-uchastie-v-olimpiyskom-otbore-po-figurnomu-kataniyu-2306846/)

**Roman Kostenkov Comments on Same-Sex Duets in Figure Skating**
Roman Kostenkov, a 2006 Olympic champion in ice dance, commented on same-sex duets in figure skating, mentioning Olympic champions Gabriella Papadakis and Guillaume Cizeron. Kostenkov said, 'I had no personal relationship with Cizeron, thank God! (Laughs.) I'm talking about the fact that he returned. Papadakis also competes on ice and skates with a woman. Let them compete, let them do what they want in France - or wherever they do it, in the US or Canada. I'm not following them. If she likes skating with a woman, and maybe he wants to skate with a man - let them skate! I won't hinder them.' Kostenkov noted that Papadakis and Cizeron's last competition was in March 2022 at the World Championships in Montpellier, France, and they announced their retirement in December 2024. Papadakis later competed in a show with American dancer Madison Hubbell, while Cizeron recently announced his return to competition without Papadakis, partnering with Canadian skater Laurence Fournier Beaudry instead.
Original language: ru
Publish date: March 06, 2025 02:16 PM
Source:[championat.com](https://www.championat.com/figureskating/news-5925992-kostomarov-vyskazalsya-ob-odnopolyh-duetah-v-figurnom-katanii-upomyanuv-papadakis-sizerona.html)

**2025 World Figure Skating Championships: China Sends Strong Team to Compete**
The 2025 International Skating Union World Figure Skating Championships will be held in Boston, USA from March 25 to 30. The International Skating Union has announced the list of participants for the men's singles, ladies' singles, pairs, and ice dance events. Due to the fact that most of the spots for the 2026 Milan Winter Olympics figure skating events will be allocated based on the results of this World Championships, all countries and regions have sent their strongest teams to compete. China's figure skating team has sent Dai David (replacing Chen Yudong), An Xiaoyi (replacing Zhu Yi), and Ren Junfei/Xing Jia Ning to participate in the men's singles, ladies' singles, and ice dance events, respectively, in an attempt to showcase their best performance. In the men's singles event, 39 skaters will compete, including the defending champion Marin, the third-place finisher in the recent Grand Prix France, Andrew Tolga Shev, and the veteran Jason Brown from the United States, as well as Japanese skaters Kiyama Yuto, Sato Shun, and Huzi Daisuke, French skater Xiao Chuanwen, Korean skater Che Junhwan, and the rising star Mikhail Sadurov from Kazakhstan. In the ladies' singles event, 33 skaters will compete, including Japanese skaters Sakamoto Kaori, Chiba Ayano, and Hiyama Shinon, Korean skaters Kim Chae-yeon, Lee Hae-rin, and Yoon Ah-sun, and American skaters Amber Glenn and Isabeau Levito. In the pairs event, 23 teams will compete, including the defending champions Diana Straton-Dudik/Maxim Dechamp from Canada, the two-time Grand Prix Final champions Vanessa James/Morgan Cipres from France, and the Georgian team Metelkina/Bezrukov, who won the gold medal at the recent Junior World Championships. In the ice dance event, 37 teams will compete, including the Chinese team Ren Junfei/Xing Jia Ning, who qualified for the World Championships by narrowly meeting the minimum technical score requirement at the recent Asian Winter Games.
Original language: zh
Publish date: March 05, 2025 07:20 AM
Source:[北青网](http://sports.ynet.com/2025/03/05/3870520t1062.html?kuaixun)

**2025 World Figure Skating Championships: China Sends Strong Team to Compete**
The International Skating Union (ISU) has announced the list of participants for the 2025 World Figure Skating Championships, which will take place in Boston, USA from March 25 to 30. The competition will feature 39 skaters in the men's singles, 33 in the ladies' singles, 23 pairs, and 37 ice dance couples. China has sent a strong team, including Dai David, An Xiaoyi, and Ren Jinfeng/Xin Jianning, who will compete in the men's singles, ladies' singles, and ice dance events, respectively. Other notable participants include reigning champion Marin, American skaters Andrew Torgashov and Jason Brown, Japanese skaters Keyamayu, Sato Jun, and Huzi Dazhe, French skater Xiao Chuanwen, and Korean skater Che Junhwan. In the ladies' singles, Japan's Sakamoto Kaori, who is the reigning champion, will be joined by 19-year-old Chiba Miyabi, who is the silver medalist at the ISU Grand Prix Final, and Hio Kuniha, who won the gold medal at the ISU Grand Prix of the United States. The Korean team will be led by 18-year-old Kim Chae-rim, who has been on a hot streak, winning the gold medal at the Asian Winter Games and the Four Continents Championships. American skaters Amber Glenn and Isabeau Levito will also be competing. In the pairs event, reigning champions Diana Strelstova/Dmitrii Aliev of Canada, two-time ISU Grand Prix Final champions Annika Hocke/Robert Kunkel of Germany, and Georgian pair Anastasia Metelkina/Nikolai Bagin, who won the gold medal at the Junior World Championships, will be among the top contenders. Japanese pair Misato Komatsubara/Timothy Koleto will also be competing after showing significant improvement in the Milan Olympic cycle. In the ice dance event, the Chinese pair Ren Jinfeng/Xin Jianning will be competing after qualifying for the championships with a minimum technical score at the Asian Winter Games. However, the Chinese adult pair did not meet the minimum technical score and will not be competing at the championships.
Original language: zh
Publish date: March 05, 2025 07:11 AM
Source:[北青网](http://sports.ynet.com/2025/03/05/3870520t1062.html)

**2025 World Junior Championships: Pairs Figure Skating Competition Underway**
The pairs figure skating competition at the 2025 World Junior Championships is underway in Debrecen. The top 5 pairs will compete in the free skate program. Currently, Anastasia Metelkina and Lukas Berulava of Georgia lead with a score of 69.18, followed by Sofia Golichenko and Artem Darenko of Ukraine with 57.40, and Zhang Xinyu and Ian Huang of China with 57.38. The competition is being streamed live on the ISU YouTube channel.

**2025 World Junior Figure Skating Championships: Free Dance Results**
The 2025 World Junior Figure Skating Championships are underway, with the pairs competing in the free dance event. The top 10 pairs after the free dance are: 1. **Kim Chae-yeon Wins Gold Medal at 2025 Four Continents Figure Skating Championships**
Kim Chae-yeon won the gold medal in the women's singles free skate at the 2025 ISU Four Continents Figure Skating Championships, held at the Mokdong Ice Rink in Seoul. She scored a total of 222.38 points, surpassing her previous personal best of 139.45 points set at the 2023 World Championships. Kim Chae-yeon said, 'I was happy to compete in front of domestic fans, but I was also nervous because I wanted to perform well. I'm grateful that I was able to break my personal record and win the gold medal.' She added, 'Believing in myself and working hard is important. Sometimes during the performance, I think 'I have to jump next, but what if I fall?' However, recently I've been thinking 'I can do it, let's skate as I practiced.' Now, she's looking forward to the World Championships, which will be held in Boston, USA, from March 24. With her recent surge in performance, she may be able to change the color of her medal.
Original language: ko
Publish date: February 23, 2025 07:55 AM
Source:[경향신문](https://sports.khan.co.kr/article/202502231624003)

**'Now, the Olympic goal is within reach': Im Haena and Kwon Ye's 6th place finish at the Four Continents Championships**
The Korean ice dance duo, Im Haena and Kwon Ye, finished 6th at the 2025 Four Continents Figure Skating Championships in Seoul. They achieved a new personal best score of 184.02 points, with a technical score of 63.09 and a program component score of 48.56 in the free dance. The pair's performance was well-received by the home crowd, who cheered them on with enthusiasm. Im Haena said, 'This competition was more meaningful because it was held in Korea. I'm happy that we achieved our highest score so far.' Kwon Ye added, 'I'm grateful for the support of the Korean fans. I feel like a true Korean now.' The duo will next compete at the 2025 ISU World Figure Skating Championships in Boston, where they will aim to qualify for the 2026 Winter Olympics. Im Haena stated, 'I'm more motivated now that I have my Korean passport. I'll work hard to achieve my goal of competing in the Olympics.' Kwon Ye confidently said, 'I'll do my best to achieve a personal best score and finish in the top 19 at the World Championships.'
Original language: ko
Publish date: February 22, 2025 12:15 PM
Source:[한겨레신문](https://www.hani.co.kr/arti/sports/sports_general/1183720.html)

**Donovan Carrillo Sets Sights on 2025 World Figure Skating Championships**
Donovan Carrillo, a Mexican figure skater, has set his sights on the 2025 World Figure Skating Championships in Boston, where he hopes to secure a spot for Mexico in the 2026 Winter Olympics. Carrillo recently competed in the Four Continents Championships in Seoul, where he achieved his best score of the season with a total of 208.73 points. Although he did not complete four elements perfectly in his free program, he expressed satisfaction with his performance, saying, 'I committed my errors but I tried to fight from the beginning to the end and I felt more comfortable than in the short program, so I'm happy about that.' Carrillo's next goal is to prepare for the World Championships, where he will aim to secure a spot for Mexico in the Olympics. 'I feel content. I think it's a step forward to my next goal, which is the World Championship. Of course, there's a lot of work to be done, but I think we're on the right path with my team together. And well, my next challenge is to get home and start preparing for the World Championships,' he said.
Original language: es
Publish date: February 22, 2025 12:00 AM
Source:[momentodeportivord.com](https://momentodeportivord.com/donovan-carrillo-logra-su-mejor-marca-de-la-temporada/)

**Donovan Carrillo Advances to Final of Four Continents Championship**
Donovan Carrillo, Mexico's figure skating star, has advanced to the final of the Four Continents Championship in Seoul. With a strong performance in the short program, he secured 13th place in the final standings with a total of 68.50 points, overcoming two mistakes in his presentation. This score not only allowed him to qualify for the final but also broke his personal best record of 67.48 points set at the Skate America 2024. Carrillo, who is aiming to secure a spot at the Winter Olympics in the 2025 World Figure Skating Championships in Boston, expressed his joy at the result, saying, 'My first goal here is to have fun and enjoy skating, which is very important and sometimes we forget. I hadn't competed too much and wanted to keep gaining experience; keep practicing quadruples before the Olympic qualifier.' He will have the opportunity to win a medal in the competition on Saturday, February 22, a goal that would give him confidence after winning the silver medal at the Challenge Cup in the Netherlands.
Original language: es
Publish date: February 20, 2025 07:52 PM
Source:[El Universal](https://www.eluniversal.com.mx/deportes/donovan-carrillo-avanza-a-la-final-del-campeonato-cuatro-continentes-buscara-la-gloria-en-corea-de-sur/)

**FOD to Broadcast 2025 World Junior Figure Skating Championships**
FOD will broadcast the entire '2025 World Junior Figure Skating Championships' on February 26 to March 1. The championships, hosted by the International Skating Union (ISU), will be held in Debrecen, Hungary. Islanda Mao, who has won the past two championships in the women's singles, will aim for a record-breaking third consecutive title. She will be joined by three other top skaters: Wada Karen, a 14-year-old middle school student, and Nakai Ami, who won the bronze medal at the 2023 championships. In the men's singles, Nakata Riki, who finished second at the 2024 championships, will aim for the 'Junior World Champion' title. Other notable skaters include Takahashi Hoshina, a 14-year-old middle school student, and Nakamura Shunsuke, who will be competing in his final junior year and aiming for his first medal. The pair of Shimizu Akari and Honda Lucas, and the ice dance team of Kishimoto Sara and Tamura Atsuhiko, will also be competing in their second consecutive junior championships.
Original language: ja
Publish date: February 18, 2025 03:00 AM
Source:[マイナビニュース](https://news.mynavi.jp/article/20250218-3128837/)

**Donovan Carrillo Wins Silver Medal in Challenge Cup 2025**
Donovan Carrillo, a 25-year-old Mexican figure skater, won the silver medal in the Challenge Cup 2025 of Figure Skating held in Tilburg, Netherlands. With a score of 205.54 points in the free program, Carrillo rose to the podium to claim the silver medal and set his personal best record. The gold medal was awarded to Japanese skater Sena Miyake with 208.37 points, while Israeli skater Mark Gorodnitsky took third place with 177.61 points. Carrillo's performance was accompanied by the music of Luis Miguel, a renowned Spanish-language singer, performing 'Tres palabras' and 'Deja que salga la luna'. This is Carrillo's second silver medal of the 2025 season, as he prepares for the Four Continents Championships and the World Figure Skating Championships. The Four Continents Championships will take place from February 19 to 23 in Seoul, South Korea, featuring top athletes from America, Asia, Africa, and Oceania.
Original language: es
Publish date: February 15, 2025 06:48 PM
Source:[noticiasenfasis.com.mx](https://www.noticiasenfasis.com.mx/donovan-carrillo-gana-la-medalla-plata-en-el-challenge-cup-2025-de-patinaje-con-canciones-de-luis-miguel/)

**Smart & Dieck Shine in European Figure Skating Championships 2025**
Olivia Smart & Tim Dieck have achieved a brilliant debut in dance at the European Figure Skating Championships 2025, securing fifth place and a second spot for Spain in the 2026 European Championships. They set a new personal best in rhythm dance and free dance, with a total score of 198.98 points. Tomás Guarino, on the other hand, finished 19th, entering the final for the fourth consecutive year and showcasing his talent on the ice. Guarino's program short started with a 3 Axel, followed by a 3 Lutz + 3 Toe, a pirouette cambiada combinada, and a sequence of steps. He scored 67.66 points and finished 21st. In the free program, Guarino started with a 3 Axel, followed by a 3 Flip + 2 Toe, a 3 Loop, a 3 Salchow, and a pirouette cambiada combinada. He finished 19th with 122.57 points. 'It was a great day,' said the team, 'we are proud of our performance and we are looking forward to the next international event, the World Championships 2025 in Boston.' 
Original language: es
Publish date: February 01, 2025 09:38 PM
Source:[Mundo Deportivo](https://www.mundodeportivo.com/deportes-invierno/20250201/1002399133/top-5-mejor-marca-personal-olivia-smart-tim-dieck-europeo-2025.html)

**Nina Petrykina - New European Champion!**
Nina Petrykina has become the new European champion after a stunning performance in the European Figure Skating Championships 2025. She scored 139.24 points in the free skate program, breaking her personal record, and a total of 208.18 points in the competition. Petrykina's impressive result earned her the championship title, as she successfully executed all elements in her program, except for a fall on a non-element, which resulted in a deduction of a single point.

**US Figure Skating Championships 2025: Final Results, Highlights and Reaction**
Ilia Malinin won his third consecutive title at the 2025 U.S. Figure Skating Championships, earning a total of 333.31 points and defeating runner-up Andrew Torgashev by 46.82 points. Malinin landed a record-tying six quadruple jumps during the free skate, including a quad flip and a quad Axel, the first ever landed by any skater. Despite falling on his fourth attempt to land seven quads, Malinin expressed satisfaction with his performance, stating, 'It wasn't the perfect program that I exactly wanted, but I think it really gives me a good, solid start of what is working in this program.' Malinin has now won every competition he's entered since the Grand Prix in France in November 2023, including last year's World Championship and two consecutive Grand Prix Finals.
Original language: en
Publish date: January 27, 2025 12:28 AM

**US Figure Skating Championships 2025: Results, Latest Schedule After Saturday**
The 2025 U.S. Figure Skating Championships continued on Saturday at Intrust Bank Arena in Wichita, Kansas. Ilia Malinin took a large lead in the Men's Short Program, breaking his own record for the largest first-place margin, and is in position to capture his third straight U.S. championship. Madison Chock and Evan Bates secured their sixth U.S. ice dance title and tied Olympic gold medalists Meryl Davis and Charlie White. Alisa Efimova and Misha Mitrofanov also finished with a gold medal in pairs, beating out defending champions Ellie Kam and Danny O'Shea. Malinin explained that he didn't want to display his entire arsenal with the 2026 Winter Olympics approaching, saying, 'I think that now that I have done the quad Axel, they want to see something more, bigger and better.' Chock dealt with an illness during competition, but Bates praised her, saying, 'Maddie has had a tough couple of days. Wasn't really able to fuel much. She's so tough. She's never not going to go out there and not give it her best.'
Original language: en
Publish date: January 26, 2025 04:05 AM
Source:[Bleacher Report](https://bleacherreport.com/articles/10152268-us-figure-skating-championships-2025-results-latest-schedule-after-saturday)

**Madison Chock and Evan Bates push through illness for sixth U.S. ice dance crown**
Madison Chock and Evan Bates won their sixth U.S. ice dance crown at the 2025 U.S. Figure Skating Championships, despite Chock dealing with a food-related stomach issue throughout the week. Their total score was 223.52, with Christina Carreira and Anthony Ponomarenko earning 210.79 for second and Caroline Green and Michael Parsons third at 205.37. Chock said, 'I'm just really proud of us. Just onwards and upwards from here.' This win ties them with 2014 Olympic champions Meryl Davis and Charlie White for the most ice dance wins at the U.S. Championships. Bates said, 'They were the ones who showed us what it takes to become the best team in the world... it's incredible to tie their record.' They will now seek their third consecutive global win at the Worlds in March, a feat that hasn't been accomplished in nearly three decades.

phase_1_result.initial_reasoning: To estimate the probability of a new world record at the 2025 World Figure Skating Championships, we start with historical frequencies. Over the past decade, world records in figure skating have been broken at various championships including the Winter Olympics and World Championships. These advancements are driven by continuous improvements in athletic performance and the evolving complexity of programs. Historically, in roughly 30% of the World Championships held every year, at least one category sees a new world record being set. This is our initial base rate for this forecast given no specific event bias.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Advancements in Training Techniques
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Recent advancements in training, including biomechanical analysis and conditioning, have been improving athletes' capabilities to execute more complex maneuvers with higher technical scores. This enhances the likelihood of new records being set as athletes push the boundaries of previous performances.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Current Athlete Performance Trends
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Current leading athletes have been consistently achieving scores near world records in recent competitions. Monitoring their performance patterns suggests they are within the range of breaking existing records, particularly with favorable conditions and peak performance during the championship.

perspective_derived_factors.name: ISU Scoring Recent Adjustments
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Adjustments in the ISU scoring system can sometimes inadvertently make record-breaking easier or more difficult. Recently, rules have tended to reward higher difficulty in technical elements more strongly, which suggests a bias towards increasing scores.

analysis_updates.points_reinforcing_prior_analysis: Multiple news articles highlight strong performances and personal best achievements among prominent skaters, such as Ilia Malinin landing a record-tying six quadruple jumps and Kim Chae-yeon setting a new personal best at the Four Continents Championships. This suggests athletes are in peak form entering the World Championships, reinforcing the likelihood of new records being set.
analysis_updates.points_challenging_prior_analysis: The conclusion of figure skating programs such as 'Figure Skating TV' and the noted decline in figure skating-related programs suggests a potential reduction in broader public support and engagement, which might indirectly affect the sports environment and resources availability. However, this is a more indirect and societal factor than one that would directly influence the outcome of setting records at the championships themselves.

summary: The experts analyzed the potential for a new world record being set at the 2025 World Figure Skating Championships. In Phase 1, the initial probabilities set by experts ranged from 20% to 50%, with final probabilities after considering various factors ranging from 45% to 85%. In Phase 2, after reviewing recent performances and news updates, all experts revised their probabilities upwards, with final revised probabilities ranging from 55% to 90%. Key factors reinforcing the likelihood of a new record included recent strong performances by skaters like Ilia Malinin and advancements in training and technology. Some challenges mentioned were a decline in figure skating media coverage and potential pressure on athletes, but these were considered minor compared to the competitive dynamics and preparation of athletes.
